## Using ITables {.smaller}

ITables works in the same way in Quarto documents as in
Jupyter notebooks:

```{python}
#| echo: true

from itables import init_notebook_mode, show
from itables.sample_dfs import get_countries


init_notebook_mode(all_interactive=True)
```

## Adjusting the itables options {.smaller}

Adjust the font, the style and possibly the number
of displayed rows to make your interactive tables fit on your slides:

```{python}
#| echo: true

import itables.options as opt


# opt.lengthMenu = [5, 10]
opt.css = ".itables { font-size: medium; }"
```

Note that

- Available sizes are documented [here](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/font-size)
- Quarto has a cache, so use `quarto render --cache-refresh` if you remove any option above

## A sample dataframe

```{python}
#| echo: true

get_countries(html=False)
```

## A complex dataframe

```{python}
#| echo: true

show(get_countries(), lengthMenu=[5, 10])
```
